modules.description: This module implements an HTTP/2 client that initiates and manages HTTP/2 connections over a provided flow. It supports sending requests with optional trailers, handling server-sent pushes, and issuing ping frames for connection health checks. Concrete use cases include building HTTP/2-based APIs, real-time communication systems, and efficient long-lived client-server interactions.

Implements HTTP/2 server logic using a provided flow module for transport. It handles incoming connections by processing HTTP/2 requests and errors on a per-socket basis. Useful for building asynchronous HTTP/2 servers that need to manage streams, headers, and data frames directly.

This module provides HTTP/2 server and client implementations for handling multiplexed request/response streams, connection management, and asynchronous frame processing over MirageOS-compatible network stacks. It defines core types like streams, headers, and frames, with operations for initiating and managing HTTP/2 connections, sending and receiving data, and handling server pushes and ping frames. The client module enables concurrent request handling and push stream management, while the server module supports per-stream processing of headers and data frames on incoming connections. Example uses include building scalable HTTP/2 APIs, real-time communication systems, and high-performance servers that process streams and trailers directly.
